content: ═══════════════════════════════════ sarah peasley an original design by handknitter ═══════════════════════════════════ phil s knee warmer ═══════════════════════════════════ my father-in-law after his knee replacement surgery complained that his new knee was cold during the winter months he requested a knee warmer which i happily provided here s the result short row add the knee bend to allow these ribbed knee warmers to move with you while keeping you warm and snug size medium large to fit knee measuring approximately 15 18 around materials for one knee warmer  yarn 52 56 grams worsted weight yarn although if you shorten the top and bottom by a few row you can probably get away with one 50 gram ball ella rae classic print 100% wool used for blue-green model henry s attic licorice twist 100% merino wool used for purple model  needles u s size 5 3 75 mm 16 inch circular and a u s size 10 6 mm needle for a very loose bind off  stitch marker  blunt darning needle gauge 24 stitches/4 inches in stockinette stitch knit at a w&t wrap and turn = leaving the yarn wherever it is firmer gauge than usual for extra snugness on the ws if you just finished a knit stitch on the rs if you just finished a purl stitch slip the next stitch key purlwise to the right-hand needle move the yarn between the needles to the other side of your work k = knit slip the slipped stitch back to the left-hand needle and then move the yarn between the needles to where it p = purl was before turn your work around rs = right side ws = wrong side © 2010 by sarah peasley handknitter this pattern can be used to make items for your own personal use for gifts or for charitable donations it can not be used to make items for sale without the permission of the designer copies may be made
